statement: As someone who came to this country from Ireland and became a citizen later in life, I believe immigration policy should be humane, fair, and efficient, recognizing both the dignity of newcomers and the legitimate needs of our communities. We ought to provide a clear, attainable path to citizenship for people who work hard, follow the law, and contribute—especially caregivers, healthcare workers, and others who fill vital roles—while ensuring due process and family unity are central to the system.

statement: I think immigration policy should be fair and consistent, with clear rules that people can actually follow, because that seems most respectful to both immigrants and citizens. Since my family has been here a long time but our ancestors came from Ireland, I feel like people who work hard, follow the law, and want to be part of American life should have a realistic path to citizenship. At the same time, the government should keep the borders secure and do background checks so people coming in don’t put others in danger.
